questions.question: What is 'flail chest'?
options: C. Consecutive, segmental fractures of multiple ribs causing paradoxical movement
D. Dislocation of a rib from the vertebra
questions.correctAnswer: C. Consecutive, segmental fractures of multiple ribs causing paradoxical movement

questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: What describes the paradoxical movement seen in flail chest during inspiration?
options: A. The flail segment moves outward with the rest of the chest wall
B. The flail segment moves inward while the rest of the chest wall expands
C. The entire chest wall fails to move
questions.correctAnswer: B. The flail segment moves inward while the rest of the chest wall expands

questions.question: The thoracic duct drains lymph from which parts of the body?
options: A. Right head, neck, arm, and thorax
B. Left head, neck, arm, thorax, and all lower body parts
C. Only the lower limbs and pelvis
D. Only the head and neck
questions.correctAnswer: B. Left head, neck, arm, thorax, and all lower body parts

questions.question: The thoracic duct typically empties into the venous system near the junction of which two veins?

B. Left internal jugular and left subclavian veins
C. Superior vena cava and azygos vein
D. Inferior vena cava and renal veins
questions.correctAnswer: B. Left internal jugular and left subclavian veins

questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: What anatomical plane divides the mediastinum into superior and inferior parts?
options: A. A transverse plane through the xiphoid process
B. A transverse plane from the sternal angle to the T4/T5 intervertebral disc
C. A sagittal plane through the midline
D. A coronal plane through the midaxillary lines
questions.correctAnswer: B. A transverse plane from the sternal angle to the T4/T5 intervertebral disc

questions.question: Why is the right dome of the diaphragm usually higher than the left?

questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: The spinal cord segments that contribute nerve fibers to the phrenic nerve are famously remembered by the mnemonic:
options: A. C1, C2 - Keep you alive too
B. C3, C4, C5 - Keep the diaphragm alive
C. C5, C6, C7 - Raise your arms to heaven
D. T1 to T4 - Sympathetics galore
questions.correctAnswer: B. C3, C4, C5 - Keep the diaphragm alive

questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: Irritation of the diaphragm (e.g., by blood, infection, or adjacent organ inflammation) can cause referred pain to which region, due to shared innervation via the phrenic nerve?

questions.correctAnswer: C. Shoulder tip (C3, C4, C5 dermatomes)
